====== DESCRIPTION ======

We are excited to announce our OPEN CALL for Issue 10 of Maake Magazine, curated by Nickola Pottinger.

Artists making work in all media are encouraged to apply. There are no restrictions on the type of work. Applicants can be based anywhere in the world. Applications will be accepted via Submittable at: https://maakemagazine.submittable.com

DEADLINE: July 11th, 2019 at 11:59 PM EST

About the Curator:
Nickola Pottinger is an artist and curator living and working in Brooklyn, New York. She recently joined the artist run gallery, Ortega Y Gasset Projects. As a co-director. Nickola was a nominee for the Rema Hort Mann emerging Artist Grant in 2018. Her work has been exhibited at Mild Climate in Nashville TN, Far X Wide, Deli Gallery, Ortega Y Gasset Projects, Industry City, and Jack Shainman Gallery in New York. Pottinger received her BFA from the Cooper Union. Nickola‚Äôs work has been written about in Hyperallergic and the Epoch Times.

About Maake:
Maake Magazine is an independent, artist-run organization that was created to support contemporary artists and other artist-run projects. It is our mission to provide exhibition opportunities as well as both online and print publishing opportunities for emerging and mid-career artists. Through collaborations with artists, curators, artist-run groups, galleries and more, we facilitate projects that support dialogue and community and increase the visibility of the arts while defying geographic boundaries. For more information about our current projects and to read interviews with all of our featured artists, artist-run organizations, and more, visit www.maakemagazine.com.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

Published Artists receive the following:
‚Ä¢Work featured in printed Issue (two full pages)
‚Ä¢One complimentary copy of Maake Magazine printed issue (US Only)
‚Ä¢Feature posted on Maake's social media outlets, website and blog
‚Ä¢Artist Interview and accompanying gallery of work posted on our website
‚Ä¢Future consideration for upcoming exhibitions and projects

Eligibility & Terms:
‚Ä¢Artists may submit up to 6 works.
‚Ä¢Artists working in all media are welcome to apply.
‚Ä¢Artists working anywhere in the world are welcome to apply.
‚Ä¢Artists must be 18 years old or older to apply.

Submission Fee: $20

Submission Requirements:
‚Ä¢6 high resolution images of work
‚Ä¢CV
‚Ä¢Short statement
‚Ä¢Short bio
‚Ä¢Social Media info

For more information, please visit: http://www.maakemagazine.com

Selected artists will be asked for high resolution images suitable for the printed magazine. Artists selected by the curator will receive a 2-page spread including a brief statement, website, and 1‚Äì4 images in print, and up to 8 images online.
